Directions: Use the information below to answer each question that follows.
Content: Changes in the concentration of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere impacts global sea level.
Rising carbon dioxide (COâ‚‚) levels are correlated with rising atmospheric temperatures. Researchers collected data, shown in Figures 1 and 2, on atmospheric carbon dioxide and global sea level.

Researchers also collected data on the Greenland ice sheet as shown in Figure 3. The Greenland ice sheet contains the second largest amount of land ice on the planet, after Antarctica. Together, these ice sheets hold more than 99% of the freshwater ice on Earth and have important impacts on global sea level and climate.
